Controller

Class TransactionsController

  • java.lang.Object
    • Controller.TransactionsController

  • public class TransactionsController
extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String FILENAME
      The file name of the database file that this controller will access

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TransactionsController() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void create(java.lang.String cinemaCode, java.lang.String name, java.lang.String email, java.lang.String mobileNumber, Movie movie)
      CREATE a new Transaction and add it into the database file Attributes are validated before creation If attributes are not allowed, throw error and do nothing If Database file exist, existing records are read and new Transaction object is aopended before saving If Database file does not exist, Transaction object will be written to a new file and saved
      void delete(java.lang.String TID, java.lang.String username)
      Delete a Transaction in the Database file, based on the TID and MovieGoer's username attribute passed
      java.util.ArrayList<Transaction> read()
      READ and return every Cineplex in the Database file If Database file not found, ignore error and return empty list
      java.util.ArrayList<Transaction> readByMovieGoerUsername(java.lang.String movieGoerUsername)
      READ and return every Transaction of a given MovieGoer's username in the Database file
      java.util.ArrayList<Transaction> readByTID(java.lang.String TID)
      READ and return every Transaction of a given TID in the Database file
      void replaceExistingFile(java.lang.String filename, java.util.ArrayList<Transaction> returnData)
      Overwrite Database file with new data of list of Admin

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public static final java.lang.String FILENAME
        The file name of the database file that this controller will access

    • Constructor Detail

      • TransactionsController

        public TransactionsController()

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public void create(java.lang.String cinemaCode,
                   java.lang.String name,
                   java.lang.String email,
                   java.lang.String mobileNumber,
                   Movie movie)
        CREATE a new Transaction and add it into the database file Attributes are validated before creation If attributes are not allowed, throw error and do nothing If Database file exist, existing records are read and new Transaction object is aopended before saving If Database file does not exist, Transaction object will be written to a new file and saved
        Parameters:
        cinemaCode - This Transaction's cinema code
        name - Name of MovieGoer of This Transaction
        email - Email of MovieGoer of This Transactins
        mobileNumber - Mobile number of MovieGoer of This Transaction
        movie - Movie of This Transaction

      • read

        public java.util.ArrayList<Transaction> read()
        READ and return every Cineplex in the Database file If Database file not found, ignore error and return empty list
        Returns:
        Model.@Transaction Return list of Transaction if any, else empty list

      • readByTID

        public java.util.ArrayList<Transaction> readByTID(java.lang.String TID)
        READ and return every Transaction of a given TID in the Database file
        Parameters:
        TID - Transaction ID of Transaction to search for
        Returns:
        Model.@Transaction Return list of Transaction if found, else empty list

      • readByMovieGoerUsername

        public java.util.ArrayList<Transaction> readByMovieGoerUsername(java.lang.String movieGoerUsername)
        READ and return every Transaction of a given MovieGoer's username in the Database file
        Parameters:
        movieGoerUsername - MovieGoer's username of Transaction to search for
        Returns:
        Model.@Transaction Return list of Transaction if found, else empty list

      • delete

        public void delete(java.lang.String TID,
                   java.lang.String username)
        Delete a Transaction in the Database file, based on the TID and MovieGoer's username attribute passed
        Parameters:
        TID - Transaction ID of Transaction which will be deleted
        username - Username of Transaction which will be deleted

      • replaceExistingFile

        public void replaceExistingFile(java.lang.String filename,
                                java.util.ArrayList<Transaction> returnData)
        Overwrite Database file with new data of list of Admin
        Parameters:
        filename - Filename to check for
        returnData - New ArrayList of Transaction to be written to the file
